Term: decimal
Explanation: Instance document fact attribute used to express the number of decimal places to which numbers have been rounded.

Term: definition relationships file
Explanation: Technical term for dimensional relationships file.

Term: dimension
Explanation: XBRL technical term for axis.

Term: domain
Explanation: An element that represents an entire set of other elements; the domain and its members are used to classify facts along the axis of a table. For example, 'Arkansas' is a domain member in the domain 'States,' and would be used to classify elements such as revenues and assets in Arkansas as distinct from other states. When a fact does not have any domain member specified, that means it applies to the entire domain.

Term: domain member
Explanation: An element representing one of the possibilities within a domain.

Term: domain-member relationship
Explanation: Dimensional relationship indicating that a domain contains the member.

Term: element
Explanation: XBRL components (items, domain members, dimensions, and so forth). The representation of a financial reporting concept, including: line items in the face of the financial statements, important narrative disclosures, and rows and columns in tables.

Term: element definition
Explanation: A human-readable description of a reporting concept. From an XBRL technical point of view, the element definition is the label with the type 'documentation,' and there are label relationships in a label relationships file, but from a user point of view the definition is an unchangeable attribute of the element.

Term: entry point
Explanation: A taxonomy entry point is identified by a unique URL (or set of URLs) that defines a logical starting point. It enables taxonomies to be filtered for specific types of reporting.

Term: extension taxonomy or extension
Explanation: A taxonomy that allows users to add to a published taxonomy in order to define new elements or change element relationships and attributes (presentation, calculation, labels, and so forth) without altering the original.

Term: face of the financial statements
Explanation: Financial statements without the notes or schedules.

Term: fact
Explanation: The occurrence in an instance document of a value or other information tagged by a taxonomy element.

Term: hierarchy
Explanation: Trees (presentation, calculation, and so forth) used to express and navigate relationships.

Term: hypercube
Explanation: XBRL technical term for a table.

Term: imputed value
Explanation: A value that is not specifically provided but could be calculated based on other provided numbers and calculation weights.

Term: instance or instance document
Explanation: XML file that contains business reporting information and represents a collection of financial facts and report-specific information using tags from one or more XBRL taxonomies.

Term: item
Explanation: XBRL technical term for a kind of element.

Term: label
Explanation: Human-readable name for an element; each element has a standard label that corresponds to the element name, and is unique across the taxonomy.

Term: label type
Explanation: A distinguishing name for each distinct element indicating the circumstances in which it should be used; each is given a separate defining role to use in different presentation situations.

Term: line item
Explanation: Elements that conventionally appear on the vertical axis (rows) of a table.

Term: linkbase
Explanation: XBRL technical term for a relationships file.

Term: mapping
Explanation: Process of determining the elements that correspond to lines and columns in a financial statement and which elements must be created by extension.

Term: name
Explanation: Unique identifier of an element in a taxonomy.

Term: namespace
Explanation: Every element has a Universal Resource Identifier (URI) that identifies the organization that maintains the element definitions, with an indication of what the term covers. In the XBRL US GAAP Taxonomy, namespaces start with http://xbrl.us/us-gaap/. A namespace prefix is not the namespace.

Term: nillable
Explanation: An attribute that appears on all taxonomy elements, and is used (false) on elements that, if used in an instance document, must have a non-empty value. XBRL taxonomy tools normally have the default value for nillable as 'true.' There is no need for any extension to define an element with nillable 'false.'

Term: Noncash or Part Noncash Acquisition, Intangible Assets Acquired
Explanation: The amount of intangibles that an Entity acquires in a noncash (or part noncash) acquisition. Noncash is defined as information about all investing and financing activities of an enterprise during a period that affect recognized assets or liabilities but that do not result in cash receipts or cash payments in the period. "Part noncash" refers to that portion of the transaction not resulting in cash receipts or cash payments in the period.

Term: Noncash or Part Noncash Acquisition, Net Nonmonetary Assets Acquired (Liabilities Assumed) (Deprecated 2011-01-31)
Explanation: The net book value of a nonmonetary asset transferred or exchanged in connection with the acquisition of a business or asset in a noncash transaction. Noncash is defined as transactions during a period that affect recognized assets or liabilities but that do not result in cash receipts or cash payments in the period. "Part noncash" refers to that portion of the transaction not resulting in cash receipts or cash payments in the period. Nonmonetary assets and liabilities are assets and liabilities that will not result in cash receipts or cash payments in the future.

Term: Noncash or Part Noncash Acquisition, Net Nonmonetary Assets Acquired (Liabilities Assumed)
Explanation: The net book value of a nonmonetary asset transferred or exchanged in connection with the acquisition of a business or asset in a noncash transaction. Noncash is defined as transactions during a period that affect recognized assets or liabilities but that do not result in cash receipts or cash payments in the period. "Part noncash" refers to that portion of the transaction not resulting in cash receipts or cash payments in the period. Nonmonetary assets and liabilities are assets and liabilities that will not result in cash receipts or cash payments in the future.

Term: Noncash or Part Noncash Acquisition, Value of Liabilities Assumed
Explanation: The total amount of [all] liabilities that an Entity assumes in acquiring a business or in consideration for an asset received in a noncash (or part noncash) acquisition. Noncash is defined as transactions during a period that affect recognized assets or liabilities but that do not result in cash receipts or cash payments in the period. "Part noncash" refers to that portion of the transaction not resulting in cash receipts or cash payments in the period.

Term: Noncash or Part Noncash Divestiture, Amount of Consideration Received
Explanation: Amount of noncash consideration received for selling an asset or business through a noncash (or part noncash) transaction.

Term: Noncash Project Abandonment Costs
Explanation: The expense charged against earnings to eliminate the capitalized costs of projects that have been terminated during the reporting period, which is added back to net income when calculating cash provided by (used in) operations using the indirect method.

Term: Noncontrolling Interest, Increase from Sale of Parent Equity Interest
Explanation: Amount of increase in noncontrolling interest from sale of a portion of the parent's controlling interest.

Term: Noncontrolling Interest, Increase from Subsidiary Equity Issuance
Explanation: Amount of increase in noncontrolling interest from subsidiary issuance of equity interests to noncontrolling interest holders.

Term: Nonfinancial Liabilities Fair Value Disclosure
Explanation: Fair value of obligations not classified as financial liabilities. Includes, but is not limited to, accounts payable and accrued liabilities, commitments, obligations, and other liabilities.

Term: Noninterest-bearing Domestic Deposit, Other
Explanation: Amount of other noninterest-bearing domestic deposit liabilities.

Term: Partners' Capital Account, Units
Explanation: The number of each class of partnership units outstanding at the balance sheet date. Units represent shares of ownership of the general, limited, and preferred partners.

Term: Partners' Capital Account, Units, Contributed
Explanation: Units contributed by each class of partners during the year. Units represent shares of ownership of the general, limited, and preferred partners.

Term: Partners' Capital Account, Units, Redeemed
Explanation: The number of units redeemed during the year of each class of partners' capital account. Units represent shares of ownership of the general, limited, and preferred partners.

Term: Partners' Capital Account, Units, Sale of Units
Explanation: Total units issued during the year due to the sale of units. All partners include general, limited and preferred partners.

Term: Partners' Capital Account, Units, Sold in Private Placement
Explanation: The number of units sold in a private placement of each class of partners' capital account. Units represent shares of ownership of the general, limited, and preferred partners.

Term: Partners' Capital Account, Units, Sold in Public Offering
Explanation: The number of units sold in a public offering of each class of partners' capital account. Units represent shares of ownership of the general, limited, and preferred partners.

Term: Partners' Capital Account, Units, Treasury Units Purchased
Explanation: Units that were previously issued and have been repurchased during the year.

Term: Partners' Capital Account, Units, Treasury Units Reissued
Explanation: Units that were previously issued and then were repurchased and classified as treasury units. This element represents the number of these units which were reissued during the period.

Term: Partners' Capital Account, Units, Unit-based Compensation
Explanation: The number of units issued due to unit-based compensation.

Term: Patronage Source Earnings
Explanation: Amount of revenue in excess of cost resulting from transactions for or with patrons.

Term: Payment for Administrative Fees
Explanation: Amount paid to managing member or general partner, affiliate of managing member or general partner, or affiliate of limited liability company (LLC) or limited partnership (LP) for administrative services provided to the LLC or LP, for example, but not limited to, salaries, rent, or overhead costs.

Term: Payment for Incentive Fee
Explanation: Amount paid for incentive rights held by the managing member or general partner, of limited liability company (LLC) or limited partnership (LP).

Term: Payment for Management Fee
Explanation: Amount paid to managing member or general partner for management of the day-to-day business functions of the limited liability company (LLC) or limited partnership (LP).

Term: Payments for Brokerage Fees
Explanation: The amount of cash paid for brokerage fees during the current period. This element is intended to represent the brokerage fees paid by and between financial industry participants.

Term: Payments for Construction in Process
Explanation: The cash outflow from construction costs to date on capital projects that have not been completed and assets being constructed that are not ready to be placed into service.

Term: Payments for Deposits with Other Institutions
Explanation: Cash paid to make deposits at other institutions during the period.

Term: Payments for Lease Commissions
Explanation: Amount of cash outflow for lease commissions incurred.

Term: Payments for Leasing Costs
Explanation: Amount of cash outflow for costs that are essential to originate the lease and would not otherwise have been incurred without the lease agreement. Amount includes, but is not limited to, cash outflows to evaluate the lessee's credit condition, guarantees, and collateral and cash outflows for costs incurred in negotiating, processing, and executing the lease agreement.

Term: Payments for Loans
Explanation: Cash payments for and related to principal collection on loans related to operating activities.

Term: Related Party Transaction, Expenses from Transactions with Related Party
Explanation: Expenses recognized resulting from transactions (excluding transactions that are eliminated in consolidated or combined financial statements) with related party.

Term: Related Party Transaction, Purchases from Related Party
Explanation: Purchases during the period (excluding transactions that are eliminated in consolidated or combined financial statements) with related party.

Term: Related Party Transaction, Rate
Explanation: Identify the stated interest rate per the agreement, for example, leasing and debt arrangements between related parties.

Term: Related Party Transaction, Selling, General and Administrative Expenses from Transactions with Related Party
Explanation: Amount of selling, general and administrative expenses resulting from transactions, excluding transactions that are eliminated in consolidated or combined financial statements, with related party.

Term: Repayments of Annuities and Investment Certificates
Explanation: The cash outflow for an insurance contract under which the policy holder make a lump sum payment or a series of payments in exchange for periodic payments to the policyholder beginning immediately or at some future date.

Term: Repayments of Construction Loans Payable
Explanation: The cash outflow from repayment of borrowings to finance the cost of construction.

Term: Repayments of Federal Home Loan Bank Borrowings
Explanation: The cash outflow for the payment of loan drawn from Federal Home Loan.

Term: Repayments of Notes Payable
Explanation: The cash outflow for a borrowing supported by a written promise to pay an obligation.

Term: Repayments of Related Party Debt
Explanation: The cash outflow for the payment of a long-term borrowing made from a related party where one party can exercise control or significant influence over another party; including affiliates, owners or officers and their immediate families, pension trusts, and so forth. Alternate caption: Payments for Advances from Affiliates.

Term: Reporting Unit, Amount of Fair Value in Excess of Carrying Amount
Explanation: Amount of fair value of reporting unit in excess of carrying amount.

Term: Reporting Unit, Percentage of Fair Value in Excess of Carrying Amount
Explanation: Percentage of fair value of reporting unit in excess of carrying amount.

Term: Repurchase Agreement Counterparty, Amount at Risk
Explanation: The amount at risk under repurchase agreements is defined as the excess of carrying amount (or market value, if higher than the carrying amount or if there is no carrying amount) of the securities or other assets sold under agreement to repurchase, including accrued interest plus any cash or other assets on deposit to secure the repurchase obligation, over the amount of the repurchase liability (adjusted for accrued interest).

Term: Required Net Capital under Commodity Exchange Act
Explanation: Amount of net capital required to be maintained under the Commodity Futures Trading Commission's (CFTC) minimum financial requirements, pursuant to the Commodity Exchange Act, less the market value of certain commodity options.

Term: Resale Agreement Counterparty, Amount at Risk
Explanation: The amount at risk under resale agreements (reverse repurchase agreements) is defined as the excess of the carrying amount of the resale agreements over the market value of assets delivered pursuant to the agreements by the counterparty to the registrant (or to a third party agent that has affirmatively agreed to act on behalf of the registrant) and not returned to the counterparty, except in exchange for their approximate market value in a separate transaction.

Term: Restricted Investments, at Fair Value
Explanation: The aggregate value of all restricted investments.

Term: Restricted Investments Exempt from Registration, at Fair Value
Explanation: The aggregate value of all restricted investments which are exempt from registration pursuant to Rule 144A.

Term: Restricted Investments Exempt from Registration, Percent of Net Assets
Explanation: The percent of net assets of the aggregate value of all restricted investments exempt from registration pursuant to Rule 144A.

Term: Restricted Investments Not Exempt from Registration, at Fair Value
Explanation: The aggregate value of all restricted investments which are not exempt from registration pursuant to Rule 144A.

Term: Share-based Compensation Arrangement by Share-based Payment Award, Non-Option Equity Instruments, Forfeitures
Explanation: Number of shares under non-option equity instrument agreements that were cancelled as a result of occurrence of a terminating event.

Term: Share-based Compensation Arrangement by Share-based Payment Award, Non-Option Equity Instruments, Forfeitures and Expirations
Explanation: Number of shares under non-option equity instrument agreements that were either cancelled or expired.

Term: Share-based Compensation Arrangement by Share-based Payment Award, Non-Option Equity Instruments, Granted
Explanation: Net number of non-option equity instruments granted to participants.

Term: Share-based Compensation Arrangement by Share-based Payment Award, Non-Option Equity Instruments, Outstanding, Number
Explanation: Number of equity instruments other than options outstanding, including both vested and non-vested instruments.

Term: Share-based Compensation Arrangement by Share-based Payment Award, Number of Additional Shares Authorized
Explanation: Number of additional shares authorized for issuance under an established share-based compensation plan.

Term: Share-based Compensation Arrangement by Share-based Payment Award, Options, Expirations in Period
Explanation: Number of options or other stock instruments for which the right to exercise has lapsed under the terms of the plan agreements.

Term: Share-based Compensation Arrangement by Share-based Payment Award, Options, Forfeitures and Expirations in Period
Explanation: For presentations that combine terminations, the number of shares under options that were cancelled during the reporting period as a result of occurrence of a terminating event specified in contractual agreements pertaining to the stock option plan or that expired.

Term: Share-based Compensation Arrangement by Share-based Payment Award, Options, Forfeitures and Expirations in Period, Weighted Average Intrinsic Value
Explanation: The combined weighted average of the accumulated differences between the fair values on underlying shares and exercises prices to acquire such shares as of the grant date on options that were either forfeited or lapsed.

Term: Share-based Compensation Arrangement by Share-based Payment Award, Options, Forfeitures in Period
Explanation: The number of shares under options that were cancelled during the reporting period as a result of occurrence of a terminating event specified in contractual agreements pertaining to the stock option plan.

Term: Share-based Compensation Arrangement by Share-based Payment Award, Options, Nonvested, Number of Shares
Explanation: Number of non-vested options outstanding.

Term: Share-based Compensation Arrangement by Share-based Payment Award, Options, Nonvested Options Forfeited, Number of Shares
Explanation: Number of non-vested options forfeited.

Term: Share-based Compensation Arrangement by Share-based Payment Award, Options, Nonvested Options Forfeited, Weighted Average Grant Date Fair Value
Explanation: Weighted average grant-date fair value of non-vested options forfeited.

Term: Share-based Compensation Arrangement by Share-based Payment Award, Options, Nonvested, Weighted Average Grant Date Fair Value
Explanation: Weighted average grant-date fair value of non-vested options outstanding.

Term: Share-based Compensation Arrangement by Share-based Payment Award, Options, Vested in Period, Fair Value
Explanation: Fair value of options vested. Excludes equity instruments other than options, for example, but not limited to, share units, stock appreciation rights, restricted stock.

Term: Share-based Compensation Arrangement by Share-based Payment Award, Options, Vested, Number of Shares
Explanation: Number of options vested.

Term: Share-based Compensation Arrangement by Share-based Payment Award, Options, Vested, Weighted Average Grant Date Fair Value
Explanation: Weighted average grant-date fair value of options vested.

Term: Share-based Compensation Arrangement by Share-based Payment Award, Percentage of Outstanding Stock Maximum
Explanation: Maximum number of shares that may be issued in accordance with the plan as a proportion of outstanding capital stock.

Term: Share-based Compensation Arrangement by Share-based Payment Award, Purchase Price of Common Stock, Percent
Explanation: Purchase price of common stock expressed as a percentage of its fair value.

Term: Share-based Compensation Arrangements by Share-based Payment Award, Options, Exercises in Period, Weighted Average Exercise Price
Explanation: Weighted average price at which option holders acquired shares when converting their stock options into shares.

Term: Valuation Allowance for Impairment of Recognized Servicing Assets, Balance
Explanation: Reflects the estimated amount of impairment as of the balance sheet date of recognized servicing assets that are being amortized in proportion to and over the period of estimated net servicing income or loss.

Term: Valuation Allowance for Impairment of Recognized Servicing Assets, Sales and Disposals
Explanation: Reduction in valuation allowance of servicing assets based on sales and disposals.

Term: Valuation Allowances and Reserves, Balance
Explanation: Total of allowances and reserves, the valuation and qualifying accounts that are either netted against the cost of an asset (in order to value it at its carrying value) or that reflect a liability established to represent expected future costs.

Term: Valuation Allowances and Reserves, Recoveries
Explanation: Total of recoveries of amounts due the Entity that had previously been written off as uncollectible using allowances (the valuation accounts that are netted against the cost of an asset to value it at its carrying value) and total of reestablishments of reserves (liabilities established to represent expected future costs) that had previously been utilized.

Term: Valuation Allowances and Reserves, Reserves of Businesses Acquired
Explanation: Total of allowances and reserves, the valuation and qualifying accounts that are either netted against the cost of an asset (in order to value it at its carrying value) or that reflect a liability established to represent expected future costs, acquired in a business combination.

Term: Warrants Not Settleable in Cash, Fair Value Disclosure
Explanation: Fair value portion of warrants not settleable in cash classified as equity.

Term: Weighted Average Interest Rate on Overdrawn Demand Deposit
Explanation: Weighted average interest rate on overdrawn demand deposit.

Term: Weighted Average Limited Partnership Units Outstanding, Diluted
Explanation: Weighted average number of limited partnership units outstanding determined by relating the portion of time within a reporting period that limited partnership units have been outstanding to the total time in that period. Used in the calculation of diluted net income or loss per limited partnership unit.

Term: Weighted Average Number of Shares Outstanding, Basic and Diluted
Explanation: Average number of shares or units issued and outstanding that are used in calculating basic and diluted earnings per share (EPS).

Term: Weighted Average Number Diluted Limited Partnership Units Outstanding Adjustment
Explanation: The sum of dilutive potential limited partnership units used in the calculation of the diluted per-unit computation.

Term: Wells in Process of Drilling
Explanation: The number of wells in the process of being drilled in each geographic area as of the date listed.

Term: Wells Temporarily Suspended
Explanation: The number of wells temporarily suspended in each geographic area as of the date listed.

Term: Withdrawal from Contract Holders Funds
Explanation: The cash outflow for a segregated fund account during the period.

Term: Accumulated Depreciation, Depletion and Amortization, Reclassifications from Property, Plant and Equipment
Explanation: Amount of decrease in accumulated depreciation, depletion and amortization as a result of reclassifications from property, plant and equipment.

Term: Accumulated Depreciation, Depletion and Amortization, Sale or Disposal of Property, Plant and Equipment
Explanation: Amount of decrease in accumulated depreciation, depletion and amortization as a result of sale or disposal of property, plant and equipment.

Term: Affordable Housing Project Investment, Write-down, Amount
Explanation: Amount of write-down from impairment of an investment in a qualified affordable housing project.

Term: Affordable Housing Tax Credits and Other Tax Benefits, Amount
Explanation: Amount of affordable housing tax credits and other tax benefits recognized.

Term: Amortization Method Qualified Affordable Housing Project Investments
Explanation: Amount of investment in qualified affordable housing projects.

Term: Amortization Method Qualified Affordable Housing Project Investments, Amortization
Explanation: Amount of amortization expense of investment in qualified affordable housing projects.

Term: Assets Held-for-sale, Not Part of Disposal Group
Explanation: Amount of assets held-for-sale that are not part of a disposal group.

Term: Payments for Repurchase of Common Stock
Explanation: The cash outflow to reacquire common stock during the period.

Term: Payments for Restructuring
Explanation: Amount of cash payments made as the result of exit or disposal activities. Excludes payments associated with a discontinued operation or an asset retirement obligation.

Term: Payments of Debt Issuance Costs
Explanation: The cash outflow paid to third parties in connection with debt origination, which will be amortized over the remaining maturity period of the associated long-term debt.

Term: Payments of Distributions to Affiliates
Explanation: The distributions of earnings to an entity that is affiliated with the reporting entity by means of direct or indirect ownership.

Term: Payments of Dividends
Explanation: Cash outflow in the form of capital distributions and dividends to common shareholders, preferred shareholders and noncontrolling interests.

Term: Payments of Financing Costs
Explanation: The cash outflow for loan and debt issuance costs.

Term: Payments of Stock Issuance Costs
Explanation: The cash outflow for cost incurred directly with the issuance of an equity security.

Term: Payments to Acquire Intangible Assets
Explanation: The cash outflow to acquire asset without physical form usually arising from contractual or other legal rights, excluding goodwill.

Term: Payments to Acquire Interest in Subsidiaries and Affiliates
Explanation: The cash outflow associated with the acquisition of or advances to an entity that is related to it but not strictly controlled (for example, an unconsolidated subsidiary, affiliate, and joint venture or equity method investment) or the acquisition of an additional interest in a subsidiary (controlled entity).

Term: Payments to Acquire Productive Assets
Explanation: The cash outflow for purchases of and capital improvements on property, plant and equipment (capital expenditures), software, and other intangible assets.

Term: Pension and Other Postretirement Defined Benefit Plans, Current Liabilities
Explanation: For a classified balance sheet, the amount recognized in balance sheet as a current liability associated with an underfunded defined benefit plan.

Term: Pension and Other Postretirement Defined Benefit Plans, Liabilities
Explanation: This represents the entire liability recognized in the balance sheet that is associated with the defined benefit plans.

Term: Pension and Other Postretirement Defined Benefit Plans, Liabilities, Noncurrent
Explanation: This represents the noncurrent liability for underfunded plans recognized in the balance sheet that is associated with the defined benefit pension plans and other postretirement defined benefit plans.

Term: Asset-Backed Securities, at Carrying Value
Explanation: Investments in notes or bonds that are collateralized by a specific group of underlying assets owned by the issuer of the notes or bonds which are short-term, highly liquid investments that are both readily convertible to known amounts of cash and so near their maturity that they present insignificant risk of changes in value because of changes in interest rates. Generally, only investments with original maturities of three months or less qualify under that definition. Original maturity means original maturity to the entity holding the investment. For example, both a three-month US Treasury bill and a three-year Treasury note purchased three months from maturity qualify as cash equivalents. However, a Treasury note purchased three-years ago does not become a cash equivalent when its remaining maturity is three months.

Term: Due from Related Parties, Current
Explanation: The aggregate amount of receivables to be collected from related parties where one party can exercise control or significant influence over another party; including affiliates, owners or officers and their immediate families, pension trusts, and so forth, at the financial statement date. which are usually due within one year (or one business cycle).

Term: Due to Related Parties
Explanation: Carrying amount as of the balance sheet date of obligations due all related parties.

Term: Investment Income, Investment Expense
Explanation: Amount of expenses related to the generation of investment income.

Term: Proceeds from Sale of Productive Assets
Explanation: The cash inflow from the sale of property, plant and equipment (capital expenditures), software, and other intangible assets.

Term: Share-based Compensation Arrangement by Share-based Payment Award, Options, Forfeitures and Expirations in Period, Weighted Average Exercise Price
Explanation: Weighted average price of options that were either forfeited or expired.

Term: Receivables, Net, Current
Explanation: The total amount due to the entity within one year of the balance sheet date (or one operating cycle, if longer) from outside sources, including trade accounts receivable, notes and loans receivable, as well as any other types of receivables, net of allowances established for the purpose of reducing such receivables to an amount that approximates their net realizable value.

Term: Temporary Equity, Accretion of Interest
Explanation: Value of accretion of temporary equity during the period due to unpaid interest.

Term: Commitments, Fair Value Disclosure
Explanation: Fair value portion of arrangements with third parties, including, but not limited to, operating lease arrangement and arrangement in which the entity has agreed to expend funds to procure goods or services, or has agreed to commit resources to supply goods or services.

Term: Intangible Assets, Net (Excluding Goodwill)
Explanation: Sum of the carrying amounts of all intangible assets, excluding goodwill, as of the balance sheet date, net of accumulated amortization and impairment charges.

Term: Interest on Convertible Debt, Net of Tax
Explanation: The after-tax amount of interest recognized in the period associated with any convertible debt.

Term: Long-term Debt and Capital Lease Obligations, Current
Explanation: Amount of long-term debt and capital leases due within one year or the normal operating cycle, if longer.

Term: Stockholders' Equity Note, Subscriptions Receivable
Explanation: Note received instead of cash as contribution to equity. The transaction may be a sale of capital stock or a contribution to paid-in capital.

Term: Property, Plant, and Equipment, Owned, Accumulated Depreciation
Explanation: The cumulative amount of depreciation (related to long-lived, depreciable flight assets owned by the entity and used in the entity's principle business operations and capitalized assets classified as property, plant and equipment that are owned by the entity) that has been recognized in the income statement.

Term: Restructuring Reserve
Explanation: Carrying amount (including both current and noncurrent portions of the accrual) as of the balance sheet date pertaining to a specified type of cost associated with exit from or disposal of business activities or restructuring pursuant to a duly authorized plan.

Term: Effective Income Tax Rate Reconciliation, Deduction, Amount
Explanation: Amount of the difference between reported income tax expense (benefit) and expected income tax expense (benefit) computed by applying the domestic federal statutory income tax rates to pretax income (loss) from continuing operations attributable to deductions. Including, but not limited to, extraterritorial income exclusion deduction, qualified production activity deduction, dividend deduction, deduction for dividend paid to employee stock ownership plan, Medicare prescription drug benefit subsidy deduction, and other deductions.

Term: Payments to Acquire Oil and Gas Property
Explanation: The cash outflow to purchase of mineral interests in oil and gas properties for use in the normal oil and gas operations and not intended for resale.

Term: Impaired Financing Receivable, Interest Income, Accrual Method
Explanation: Amount of interest income recognized that the financing receivables (with related allowance for credit losses and without a related allowance for credit losses) were impaired.

Term: Operating Loss Carryforwards
Explanation: Amount of operating loss carryforward, before tax effects, available to reduce future taxable income under enacted tax laws.

Term: Property, Plant and Equipment, Gross
Explanation: Amount before accumulated depreciation, depletion and amortization of physical assets used in the normal conduct of business and not intended for resale. Examples include, but are not limited to, land, buildings, machinery and equipment, office equipment, and furniture and fixtures.

Term: Financial Instruments, Owned, US Government and Agency Obligations, at Fair Value
Explanation: The fair value as of the balance sheet date of firm holdings in debt obligations issued by the US government including short-term Treasury bills, medium-term Treasury notes, and long-term Treasury bonds, as well as debt issued by agencies. Includes both pledged (to counterparties as collateral for financing transactions) and unpledged holdings.

Term: Impairment of Long-Lived Assets Held-for-use
Explanation: The aggregate amount of write-downs for impairments recognized during the period for long lived assets held for use (including those held for disposal by means other than sale).

Term: Defined Benefit Plan, Divestitures, Plan Assets
Explanation: The amount of decrease in the plan assets attributed to the sale, liquidation, spin-off or other divestiture of a corporate division or subsidiary.

Term: Deposits, Fair Value Disclosure
Explanation: Fair value portion of deposit liabilities held by the entity, including, but not limited to, foreign and domestic, interest and noninterest bearing, demand deposits, saving deposits, negotiable orders of withdrawal (NOW) and time deposits.

Term: Financing Receivable, Allowance for Credit Losses
Explanation: A valuation allowance for financing receivables that are expected to be uncollectible.

Term: Secured Debt, Current
Explanation: Carrying value as of the balance sheet date of the portion of long-term, collateralized debt obligations due within one year or the operating cycle, if longer. Such obligations include mortgage loans, chattel loans, and any other borrowings secured by assets of the borrower.

Term: Inventory, LIFO Reserve
Explanation: Amount by which inventory stated at last-in first-out (LIFO) is less than (in excess of) inventory stated at other inventory cost methods.

Term: Payments to Acquire Businesses and Interest in Affiliates
Explanation: The cash outflow associated with the acquisition of a controlling interest in another entity or an entity that is related to it but not strictly controlled (for example, an unconsolidated subsidiary, affiliate, joint venture or equity method investment).

Term: Financing Receivable, Recorded Investment, Nonaccrual Status
Explanation: Recorded investment in financing receivables that are on nonaccrual status as of the balance sheet date.

Term: Available-for-sale Securities, Continuous Unrealized Loss Position, Less than Twelve Months, Fair Value
Explanation: This item represents the aggregate fair value of investments in debt and equity securities categorized neither as held-to-maturity nor trading securities that have been in a continuous unrealized loss position for less than twelve months.

Term: Limited Partners' Capital Account, Distribution Amount
Explanation: The total amount of distributions to limited partners.

Term: Selling and Marketing Expense
Explanation: The aggregate total amount of expenses directly related to the marketing or selling of products or services.

Term: Long-term Debt, Excluding Current Maturities
Explanation: Amount after unamortized (discount) premium and debt issuance costs of long-term debt classified as noncurrent and excluding amounts to be repaid within one year or the normal operating cycle, if longer. Includes, but not limited to, notes payable, bonds payable, debentures, mortgage loans and commercial paper. Excludes capital lease obligations.

Term: Proceeds from Divestiture of Interest in Consolidated Subsidiaries
Explanation: The cash inflow associated with the deconsolidation of a previously consolidated subsidiary or the sale of investment in consolidated subsidiaries (generally greater than 50 percent).

Term: Deferred Tax Assets, Net, Noncurrent
Explanation: Amount, after allocation of valuation allowances and deferred tax liability, of deferred tax asset attributable to deductible differences and carryforwards, with jurisdictional netting and classified as noncurrent.

Term: Share-based Compensation Arrangement by Share-based Payment Award, Options, Grants in Period, Gross
Explanation: Gross number of share options (or share units) granted during the period.

Term: Defined Benefit Plan, Contributions by Employer
Explanation: Amount of contributions made by the employer to defined benefit plans.

Term: Financing Receivable, Allowance for Credit Losses, Collectively Evaluated for Impairment
Explanation: The valuation allowance for financing receivables that are expected to be uncollectible that were collectively evaluated for impairment.

Term: Payments to Fund Long-term Loans to Related Parties
Explanation: The cash outflow associated with extending a long-term loan to a related party. Alternate caption: Payments for Advances to Affiliates.

Term: Legal Fees
Explanation: The amount of expense provided in the period for legal costs incurred on or before the balance sheet date pertaining to resolved, pending or threatened litigation, including arbitration and mediation proceedings.

Term: Payments to Acquire Other Productive Assets
Explanation: Amount of cash outflow for the purchase of or improvements to tangible or intangible assets, used to produce goods or deliver services, classified as other.

Term: Payments to Acquire Short-term Investments
Explanation: The cash outflow for securities or other assets acquired, which qualify for treatment as an investing activity and are to be liquidated, if necessary, within the current operating cycle. Includes cash flows from securities classified as trading securities that were acquired for reasons other than sale in the short-term.

Term: Deferred Tax Assets, Tax Deferred Expense, Other
Explanation: Amount, before allocation of valuation allowance, of deferred tax asset attributable to deductible temporary differences from provisions, reserves, allowances, and accruals, classified as other.

Term: Impairment of Intangible Assets (Excluding Goodwill)
Explanation: The amount of impairment loss recognized in the period resulting from the write-down of the carrying amount of an intangible asset (excluding goodwill) to fair value.

Term: Other Assets, Current
Explanation: Amount of current assets classified as other.

Term: Weighted Average Number of Shares, Employee Stock Ownership Plan Shares Not Committed to be Released
Explanation: Number of employee stock ownership plan (ESOP) shares that have not been committed to be released determined by relating the portion of time within a reporting period that these shares have been outstanding to the total time in that period.

Term: Deferred Tax Liabilities, Deferred Expense
Explanation: Amount of deferred tax liability attributable to taxable temporary differences from capitalized costs.

Term: Payments to Acquire Other Investments
Explanation: Amount of cash outflow to acquire investments classified as other.

Term: Standard and Extended Product Warranty Accrual, Increase for Warranties Issued
Explanation: Amount of increase in the standard and extended product warranty accrual from warranties issued.

Term: SEC Schedule III, Real Estate, Cost of Real Estate Sold
Explanation: Amount of real estate investments sold for entities with a substantial portion of business acquiring and holding investment real estate.

Term: Share-based Compensation Arrangement by Share-based Payment Award, Options, Outstanding, Number
Explanation: Number of options outstanding, including both vested and non-vested options.

Term: Accounts Receivable, Net, Current
Explanation: Amount due from customers or clients, within one year of the balance sheet date (or the normal operating cycle, whichever is longer), for goods or services (including trade receivables) that have been delivered or sold in the normal course of business, reduced to the estimated net realizable fair value by an allowance established by the entity of the amount it deems uncertain of collection.

Term: Accumulated Distributions in Excess of Net Income
Explanation: The amount as of the balance sheet date by which cumulative distributions to shareholders (or partners) exceed retained earnings (or accumulated earnings).

Term: Available-for-sale Securities
Explanation: Amount of investment in debt and equity securities categorized neither as held-to-maturity nor trading.

Term: Fair Value of Assets Acquired
Explanation: The fair value of assets acquired in noncash investing or financing activities.

Term: Payments of Ordinary Dividends, Noncontrolling Interest
Explanation: Amount of cash outflow in the form of ordinary dividends provided by the non-wholly owned subsidiary to noncontrolling interests.

Term: Equity Method Investment, Summarized Financial Information, Cost of Sales
Explanation: The amount of the cost of sales reported by an equity method investment of the entity.

Term: Paid-in-Kind Interest
Explanation: Interest paid other than in cash for example by issuing additional debt securities. As a noncash item, it is added to net income when calculating cash provided by or used in operations using the indirect method.

Term: SEC Schedule III, Real Estate Accumulated Depreciation, Real Estate Sold
Explanation: Amount of decrease to accumulated depreciation for real estate investments sold for entities with a substantial portion of business acquiring and holding investment real estate.

Term: Write off of Deferred Debt Issuance Cost
Explanation: Write-off of amounts previously capitalized as debt issuance cost in an extinguishment of debt.

Term: Deferred Tax Assets, Tax Deferred Expense, Reserves and Accruals, Accrued Liabilities
Explanation: Amount before allocation of valuation allowances of deferred tax asset attributable to deductible temporary differences from accrued liabilities.

Term: Deferred Tax Liabilities, Other Comprehensive Income
Explanation: Amount of deferred tax liability attributable to taxable temporary differences from unrealized gains in other comprehensive income.

Term: Financing Receivable, Recorded Investment, Current
Explanation: Financing receivables that are current.

Term: Preferred Stock, Amount of Preferred Dividends in Arrears
Explanation: Aggregate amount of cumulative preferred dividends in arrears.

Term: Ceded Premiums Written
Explanation: Amount of written premiums ceded to other entities.

Term: Costs and Expenses, Related Party
Explanation: Costs of sales and operating expenses for the period incurred from transactions with related parties.

Term: Deferred Tax Liabilities, Goodwill and Intangible Assets
Explanation: Amount of deferred tax liability attributable to taxable temporary differences from intangible assets including goodwill.

Term: Exploration Expense
Explanation: Exploration expenses (including prospecting) related to oil and gas producing entities and would be included in operating expenses of that entity. Costs incurred in identifying areas that may warrant examination and in examining specific areas that are considered to have prospects of containing oil and gas reserves, including costs of drilling exploratory wells and exploratory-type stratigraphic test wells. Exploration costs may be incurred both before acquiring the related property (sometimes referred to in part as prospecting costs) and after acquiring the property. Principal types of exploration costs, which include depreciation and applicable operating costs of support equipment and facilities and other costs of exploration activities, are: (i) Costs of topographical, geographical and geophysical studies, rights of access to properties to conduct those studies, and salaries and other expenses of geologists, geophysical crews, and others conducting those studies. Collectively, these are sometimes referred to as geological and geophysical or "G&G" costs. (ii) Costs of carrying and retaining undeveloped properties, such as delay rentals, ad valorem taxes on properties, legal costs for title defense, and the maintenance of land and lease records. (iii) Dry hole contributions and bottom hole contributions. (iv) Costs of drilling and equipping exploratory wells. (v) Costs of drilling exploratory-type stratigraphic test wells.

Term: Effective Income Tax Rate Reconciliation, Tax Credit, Investment, Amount
Explanation: Amount of the difference between reported income tax expense (benefit) and expected income tax expense (benefit) computed by applying the domestic federal statutory income tax rates to pretax income (loss) from continuing operations attributable to investment tax credit.

Term: Effective Income Tax Rate Reconciliation, Tax Credit, Other, Amount
Explanation: Amount of the difference between reported income tax expense (benefit) and expected income tax expense (benefit) computed by applying the domestic federal statutory income tax rates to pretax income (loss) from continuing operations attributable to other tax credits.

Term: Payments for Commissions
Explanation: The amount of cash paid for commissions during the current period.

Term: Proceeds from Income Tax Refunds
Explanation: The amount of cash received during the period as refunds for the overpayment of taxes.

Term: Business Combination, Recognized Identifiable Assets Acquired and Liabilities Assumed, Finite-Lived Intangibles
Explanation: The amount of identifiable intangible assets recognized as of the acquisition date.

Term: Convertible Debt, Current
Explanation: The portion of the carrying value of long-term convertible debt as of the balance sheet date that is scheduled to be repaid within one year or in the normal operating cycle if longer. Convertible debt is a financial instrument which can be exchanged for a specified amount of another security, typically the entity's common stock, at the option of the issuer or the holder.

Term: Mortgage-backed Securities Available-for-sale, Fair Value Disclosure
Explanation: Fair value of securitized, pay-through debt securities collateralized by real estate mortgage loans classified as available-for-sale.

Term: Interest Rate Derivative Liabilities, at Fair Value
Explanation: Fair value as of the balance sheet date of interest rate derivative liabilities, which includes all such derivative instruments in hedging and nonhedging relationships that are recognized as liabilities.

Term: Foreign Currency Contract, Asset, Fair Value Disclosure
Explanation: Fair value portion of asset contracts related to the exchange of different currencies, including, but not limited to, foreign currency options, forward contracts, and swaps.

Term: Other than Temporary Impairment Losses, Investments, Portion Recognized in Earnings, Net, Held-to-maturity Securities
Explanation: The amount of other than temporary impairment losses on investments in debt securities categorized as Held-to-maturity which have been recognized in earnings during the period. Such impairment losses consist of other than temporary impairments (OTTI) of investments in debt securities due to credit losses and other than temporary impairments due to other than credit losses when the entity intends to sell an impaired debt security or it is more likely than not that the entity will be required to sell the impaired debt security before recovery of its amortized cost basis.

Term: Interest Rate Derivative Assets, at Fair Value
Explanation: Fair value as of the balance sheet date of interest rate derivative assets, which includes all such derivative instruments in hedging and nonhedging relationships that are recognized as assets.

Term: Financial Instruments, Owned, Corporate Debt, at Fair Value
Explanation: Fair value of firm holdings in corporate fixed income securities. Includes pledged and unpledged holdings.

Term: Embedded Derivative, No Longer Bifurcated, Amount Reclassified to Stockholders' Equity
Explanation: The amount of the liability for the conversion option reclassified to stockholders' equity when the embedded option no longer required separation from the host instrument.

Term: Finite-Lived Intangible Asset, Off-market Lease, Favorable, Gross
Explanation: This element represents the identifiable intangible asset established upon acquisition based on a favorable difference between the terms of an acquired lease and the current market terms for that lease at the acquisition date.

Term: Loans and Leases Receivable, Related Parties
Explanation: For an unclassified balance sheet, reflects the carrying amount of unpaid loan amounts due from related parties at the balance sheet date.

Term: Notes and Loans Payable, Current
Explanation: Sum of the carrying values as of the balance sheet date of the portions of all long-term notes and loans payable due within one year or the operating cycle if longer.

Term: Repayments of Bank Debt
Explanation: The cash outflow to settle a bank borrowing during the year.

Term: Unrealized Gain on Securities
Explanation: The increase (decrease), resulting in a gain, in the difference between the fair value and the carrying value, or in the comparative fair values, of securities held at each balance sheet date, that was included in earnings for the period.

Term: Accounts Receivable, Related Parties
Explanation: For an unclassified balance sheet, amount of receivables arising from transactions with related parties.

Term: Other Assets, Noncurrent
Explanation: Amount of noncurrent assets classified as other.

Term: Payments of Debt Restructuring Costs
Explanation: The cash outflow for cost incurred in the modification of term of existing debt agreement in order for the entity to achieve some advantage.

Term: Assets, Noncurrent
Explanation: Sum of the carrying amounts as of the balance sheet date of all assets that are expected to be realized in cash, sold or consumed after one year or beyond the normal operating cycle, if longer.

Term: Effective Income Tax Rate Reconciliation, Nondeductible Expense, Impairment Losses, Amount
Explanation: Amount of the difference between reported income tax expense (benefit) and expected income tax expense (benefit) computed by applying the domestic federal statutory income tax rates to pretax income (loss) from continuing operations attributable to nondeductible impairment loss.

Term: Notes Payable, Related Parties, Noncurrent
Explanation: The amount for notes payable (written promise to pay), payable to related parties, which are due after one year (or one business cycle).

Term: Payments for Deposits
Explanation: The amount of cash paid for deposits on goods and services during the period; excludes time deposits and deposits with other institutions, which pertain to financial service entities.

Term: Payments to Acquire Restricted Certificates of Deposit
Explanation: The cash outflow from temporary investment with specific maturity and interest rate that are prohibited for current use.

Term: Securities Sold under Agreements to Repurchase
Explanation: Amount, after the effects of master netting arrangements, of funds outstanding borrowed in the form of a security repurchase agreement between the entity and another party for the sale and repurchase of identical or substantially the same securities at a date certain for a specified price. Includes liabilities not subject to a master netting arrangement and not elected to be offset.

Term: Stock Issued During Period, Shares, Share-based Compensation, Forfeited
Explanation: Number of shares (or other type of equity) forfeited during the period.

Term: Unrealized Loss on Securities
Explanation: The increase (decrease), resulting in a loss, in the difference between the fair value and the carrying value, or in the comparative fair values, of securities held at each balance sheet date, that was included in earnings for the period.

Term: Certificates of Deposit, at Carrying Value
Explanation: A savings certificate entitling the Entity (that is, bearer) to receive interest at an established maturity date, based upon a fixed interest rate. A certificate of deposit may be issued in any denomination. Certificates of deposit are generally issued by commercial banks and, therefore, insured by the FDIC (up to the prescribed limit). Certificates of deposit generally restrict holders from withdrawing funds on demand without the incurrence of penalties. Generally, only certificates of deposit with original maturities of three months or less qualify as cash equivalents. Original maturity means original maturity to the entity holding the investment. As a related example, both a three-month US Treasury bill and a three-year Treasury note purchased three months from maturity qualify as cash equivalents. However, a Treasury note purchased three-years ago does not become a cash equivalent when its remaining maturity is three months.

Term: Convertible Debt, Noncurrent
Explanation: Carrying amount of long-term convertible debt as of the balance sheet date, net of the amount due in the next twelve months or greater than the normal operating cycle, if longer. The debt is convertible into another form of financial instrument, typically the entity's common stock.

Term: Costs in Excess of Billings
Explanation: Amount of receivable reflecting the cost incurred on uncompleted contracts in excess of related billings.

Term: Deferred Tax Assets, Inventory
Explanation: Amount before allocation of valuation allowances of deferred tax asset attributable to deductible temporary differences from inventory.

Term: Other Additional Capital
Explanation: Amount of additional paid-in capital (APIC) classified as other.

Term: Payments to Acquire Assets, Investing Activities
Explanation: Aggregate cash payments for a combination of transactions that are classified as investing activities in which assets, which may include securities, other types of investments, or productive assets, are purchased from third-party sellers. This element can be used by entities to aggregate payments for all asset purchases that are classified as investing activities.

Term: Payments to Employees
Explanation: Payments of cash to employees, including wages and salaries, during the current period.

Term: Accounts Receivable, Net
Explanation: For an unclassified balance sheet, the amount due from customers or clients for goods or services that have been delivered or sold in the normal course of business, reduced to their estimated net realizable fair value by an allowance established by the entity of the amount it deems uncertain of collection.

Term: Antidilutive Securities Excluded from Computation of Earnings Per Share, Amount
Explanation: Securities (including those issuable pursuant to contingent stock agreements) that could potentially dilute basic earnings per share (EPS) or earnings per unit (EPU) in the future that were not included in the computation of diluted EPS or EPU because to do so would increase EPS or EPU amounts or decrease loss per share or unit amounts for the period presented.

Term: Deferred Tax Liabilities, Goodwill
Explanation: Amount of deferred tax liability attributable to taxable temporary differences from goodwill.

Term: Deferred Tax Liabilities, Undistributed Foreign Earnings
Explanation: Amount of deferred tax liability attributable to taxable temporary differences from undistributed earnings of subsidiaries and other recognized entities not within the country of domicile of the entity.

Term: Defined Benefit Pension Plan Liabilities, Current
Explanation: This represents the current liability recognized in the balance sheet that is associated with the defined benefit pension plans.

Term: Liabilities, Noncurrent
Explanation: Amount of obligation due after one year or beyond the normal operating cycle, if longer.

Term: Preferred Stock, Dividends Per Share, Declared
Explanation: Aggregate dividends declared during the period for each share of preferred stock outstanding.

Term: Short-term Debt, Fair Value
Explanation: This element represents the portion of the balance sheet assertion valued at fair value by the entity whether such amount is presented as a separate caption or as a parenthetical disclosure. Additionally, this element may be used in connection with the fair value disclosures required in the footnote disclosures to the financial statements. The element may be used in both the balance sheet and disclosure in the same submission. This item represents the amount of short-term debt existing as of the balance sheet date.

Term: Derivative Instruments in Hedges, Assets, at Fair Value
Explanation: Aggregate fair value of all derivative assets designated as hedging instruments. Includes instruments designated as cash flow hedges, fair value hedges, and hedges of net investments in foreign operations.

Term: Repayments of Other Long-term Debt
Explanation: Amount of cash outflow for the payment of debt classified as other, maturing after one year or the operating cycle, if longer.

Term: Deferred Policy Acquisition Costs and Value of Business Acquired
Explanation: Carrying (unamortized) amount as of the balance sheet date of deferred policy acquisition costs and value of business acquired (also called present value of future profits).

Term: Deferred Tax Assets, Tax Deferred Expense, Compensation and Benefits, Postretirement Benefits
Explanation: Amount before allocation of valuation allowances of deferred tax asset attributable to deductible temporary differences from postretirement benefits.

Term: Deferred Tax Assets, Unrealized Losses on Available-for-Sale Securities, Gross
Explanation: Amount before allocation of valuation allowances of deferred tax asset attributable to deductible temporary differences from unrealized losses on available-for-sale securities.

Term: Payments for Other Fees
Explanation: Amount of cash outflow for fees classified as other.

Term: Shares Paid for Tax Withholding for Share Based Compensation
Explanation: For net-share settlement of share-based awards when the employer settles employees' income tax withholding obligations, this element represents the number of shares the employees use to repay the employer.

Term: Financial Instruments Subject to Mandatory Redemption, Settlement Terms, Share Value, Amount
Explanation: Amount that would be paid, determined under the conditions specified in the contract, if the holder of the share has the right to redeem the shares.

Term: Additional Collateral, Aggregate Fair Value
Explanation: The aggregate fair value of additional assets that would be required to be posted as collateral for derivative instruments with credit-risk-related contingent features if the credit-risk-related contingent features were triggered at the end of the reporting period.

Term: Asset Retirement Obligation, Current
Explanation: Current portion of the carrying amount of a liability for an asset retirement obligation. An asset retirement obligation is a legal obligation associated with the disposal or retirement of a tangible long-lived asset that results from the acquisition, construction or development, or the normal operations of a long-lived asset, except for certain obligations of lessees.

Term: Deferred Tax Liabilities, Inventory
Explanation: Amount of deferred tax consequences attributable to taxable temporary differences derived from inventory.

Term: Excess of Replacement or Current Costs over Stated LIFO Value
Explanation: The excess of replacement or current cost over the stated LIFO (last in first out) inventory value when the LIFO inventory method is utilized.

Term: Fair Value Hedge Liabilities
Explanation: Fair value of all derivative liabilities designated as fair value hedging instruments.

Term: Interest Payable, Current
Explanation: Carrying value as of the balance sheet date of [accrued] interest payable on all forms of debt, including trade payables, that has been incurred and is unpaid. Used to reflect the current portion of the liabilities (due within one year or within the normal operating cycle if longer).

Term: Notes and Loans Payable
Explanation: Including the current and noncurrent portions, carrying value as of the balance sheet date of all notes and loans payable (with maturities initially due after one year or beyond the operating cycle if longer).

Term: Payments to Acquire Held-to-maturity Securities
Explanation: Amount of cash outflow through purchase of long-term held-to-maturity securities.

Term: Real Estate Acquired Through Foreclosure
Explanation: Carrying amount as of the balance sheet date of land and buildings obtained through foreclosure proceedings or defeasance in full or partial satisfaction of a debt arrangement.

Term: Receivables from Brokers-Dealers and Clearing Organizations
Explanation: Amount receivable from broker-dealers and clearing organizations, including, but not limited to, securities failed-to-deliver, certain deposits for securities borrowed, open transactions, good faith and margin deposits, commissions and floor brokerage receivables.

Term: Restricted Cash and Cash Equivalents
Explanation: The carrying amounts of cash and cash equivalent items which are restricted as to withdrawal or usage. Restrictions may include legally restricted deposits held as compensating balances against borrowing arrangements, contracts entered into with others, or entity statements of intention with regard to particular deposits; however, time deposits and short-term certificates of deposit are not generally included in legally restricted deposits. Excludes compensating balance arrangements that are not agreements which legally restrict the use of cash amounts shown on the balance sheet. This element is for unclassified presentations; for classified presentations there is a separate and distinct element.

Term: Accounts Receivable, Related Parties, Current
Explanation: Amount of receivables arising from transactions with related parties due within one year or the normal operating cycle, if longer.

Term: Advances to Affiliate
Explanation: Long-Term advances receivable from a party that is affiliated with the reporting entity by means of direct or indirect ownership. This does not include advances to clients.

Term: Allowance for Loan and Lease Losses, Real Estate
Explanation: The reserve to cover probable credit losses related to specifically identified fixed maturity real estate loans as well as probable credit losses inherent in the remainder of that loan portfolio.

Term: Common Stock Held by Subsidiary
Explanation: Value of entity shares held by subsidiary, which are purchased for the purpose of granting the shares to senior employees as part of an employee stock option plan approved by the Entity's Board of Directors. Presented as a reduction of shareholders' equity at their cost to the subsidiary.

Term: Interest Receivable
Explanation: Carrying amount as of the balance sheet date of interest earned but not received. Also called accrued interest or accrued interest receivable.

Term: Investments
Explanation: Sum of the carrying amounts as of the balance sheet date of all investments.

Term: Other Investments
Explanation: Amount of investments classified as other.

Term: Payments for Repurchase of Warrants
Explanation: The aggregate amount paid by the entity to reacquire the right to purchase equity shares at a predetermined price, usually issued together with corporate debt.

Term: Disposal Group, Including Discontinued Operation, Assets, Current
Explanation: Amount classified as assets attributable to disposal group held for sale or disposed of, expected to be disposed of within one year or the normal operating cycle, if longer.

Term: Deferred Tax Assets, Operating Loss Carryforwards, Domestic
Explanation: Amount before allocation of valuation allowances of deferred tax asset attributable to deductible domestic operating loss carryforwards. Excludes state and local operating loss carryforwards.

Term: Deferred Tax Assets, Other Comprehensive Loss
Explanation: Amount before allocation of valuation allowances of deferred tax asset attributable to deductible temporary differences from unrealized losses in other comprehensive income.

Term: Defined Benefit Plan, Actual Plan Asset Allocations
Explanation: Percentage of fair value of investments (categorized by debt securities, equity securities, real estate and other plan assets) to the fair value of plan assets held.

Term: Due to Affiliate, Current
Explanation: Amount of payable due to an entity that is affiliated with the reporting entity by means of direct or indirect ownership. Used to reflect the current portion of the liabilities (due within one year or within the normal operating cycle if longer).

Term: Cash and Cash Equivalents, at Carrying Value, Including Discontinued Operations
Explanation: For the entity and the disposal group, cash includes currency on hand as well as demand deposits with banks or financial institutions. It also includes other kinds of accounts that have the general characteristics of demand deposits in that the Entity may deposit additional funds at any time and also effectively may withdraw funds at any time without prior notice or penalty. Cash equivalents, excluding items classified as marketable securities, include short-term, highly liquid investments that are both readily convertible to known amounts of cash, and so near their maturity that they present minimal risk of changes in value because of changes in interest rates. Generally, only investments with original maturities of three months or less qualify under that definition. Original maturity means original maturity to the entity holding the investment. For example, both a three-month US Treasury bill and a three-year Treasury note purchased three months from maturity qualify as cash equivalents. However, a Treasury note purchased three years ago does not become a cash equivalent when its remaining maturity is three months. Compensating balance arrangements that do not legally restrict the withdrawal or usage of cash amounts may be reported as Cash and Cash Equivalents, while legally restricted deposits held as compensating balances against borrowing arrangements, contracts entered into with others, or company statements of intention with regard to particular deposits are not generally reported as cash and cash equivalents.

Term: Cash Flow Hedge Derivative Instrument Liabilities at Fair Value
Explanation: Fair value of all liability derivatives designated as cash flow hedging instruments.

Term: Decommissioning Fund Investments, Fair Value
Explanation: The fair value of investments held in a trust fund to pay for the costs of decontaminating and decommissioning facilities, whether such amount is presented as a separate caption or as a parenthetical disclosure on the balance sheet. Additionally, this element may be used in connection with the fair value disclosures required in the footnote disclosures to the financial statements.

Term: Deferred Tax Assets, Tax Deferred Expense, Compensation and Benefits
Explanation: Amount before allocation of valuation allowances of deferred tax asset attributable to deductible temporary differences from compensation and benefits costs.

Term: Deferred Tax Liabilities, Deferred Expense, Debt Issuance Costs
Explanation: Amount of deferred tax liability attributable to taxable temporary differences from debt issuance costs.

Term: Deferred Tax Liabilities, Deferred Expense, Other Capitalized Costs
Explanation: Amount of deferred tax liability attributable to taxable temporary differences from capitalized costs classified as other.

Term: Due from Affiliates
Explanation: For an unclassified balance sheet, amount of receivables due from an entity that is affiliated with the reporting entity by means of direct or indirect ownership.

Term: Due to Affiliate, Noncurrent
Explanation: Amount of receivables owed to an entity that is affiliated with the reporting entity by means of direct or indirect ownership, which are usually due after one year (or one business cycle, if longer).

Term: Qualitative and Quantitative Information, Transferor's Continuing Involvement, Arrangements of Financial Support, Amount
Explanation: The transferor's maximum amount of exposure to loss as a result of its continuing involvement in transferred financial assets.

Term: SEC Schedule III, Real Estate, Gross
Explanation: Amount, before accumulated depreciation, of real estate investments for entities with a substantial portion of business acquiring and holding investment real estate.

Term: Regulatory Assets, Noncurrent
Explanation: Carrying amount as of the balance sheet date of capitalized costs of regulated entities that are not expected to be recovered through revenue sources within one year or the normal operating cycle if longer.

Term: Senior Notes
Explanation: Including the current and noncurrent portions, carrying value as of the balance sheet date of Notes with the highest claim on the assets of the issuer in case of bankruptcy or liquidation (with maturities initially due after one year or beyond the operating cycle if longer). Senior note holders are paid off in full before any payments are made to junior note holders.

Term: Loans and Leases Receivable, Loans in Process
Explanation: Amount of undisbursed portion of the loan receivable balance (loans in process). Excludes loans and leases covered under loss sharing agreements.

Term: Loans Held-for-sale, Fair Value Disclosure
Explanation: Fair value portion of loans held-for-sale including, but not limited to, mortgage loans and finance receivables.

Term: Long-term Debt, Maturities, Repayments of Principal in Year Five
Explanation: Amount of long-term debt payable, sinking fund requirements, and other securities issued that are redeemable by holder at fixed or determinable prices and dates maturing in the fifth fiscal year following the latest fiscal year. Excludes interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

Term: Notes Payable, Fair Value Disclosure
Explanation: Fair value portion of notes payable.

Term: Payments for Postemployment Benefits
Explanation: Cash outflows for payments of postemployment benefits (such as severance pay and health insurance benefits) recognized during the period. Postemployment benefits are benefits paid to employees after employment but before retirement.

Term: Payments of Ordinary Dividends
Explanation: Cash outflow in the form of ordinary dividends to common shareholders, preferred shareholders and noncontrolling interests, generally out of earnings.

Term: Preferred Stock, Redemption Amount
Explanation: The redemption (or callable) amount of currently redeemable preferred stock. Includes amounts representing dividends not currently declared or paid but which will be payable under the redemption features or for which ultimate payment is solely within the control of the issuer.

Term: Preferred Stock, Value, Issued
Explanation: Aggregate par or stated value of issued nonredeemable preferred stock (or preferred stock redeemable solely at the option of the issuer). This item includes treasury stock repurchased by the entity. Note: elements for number of nonredeemable preferred shares, par value and other disclosure concepts are in another section within stockholders' equity.

Term: Short-term Debt
Explanation: Reflects the total carrying amount as of the balance sheet date of debt having initial terms less than one year or the normal operating cycle, if longer.

Term: Accounts Payable, Related Parties
Explanation: Amount for accounts payable to related parties.

Term: Accrued Fees and Other Revenue Receivable
Explanation: For an unclassified balance sheet, the amount of fees and other revenue, excluding investment income receivable, earned but not yet received, which were recognized in conformity with revenue recognition criteria based on estimates or specific contractual terms.

Term: Business Acquisition, Equity Interest Issued or Issuable, Value Assigned
Explanation: Value of equity interests (such as common shares, preferred shares, or partnership interest) issued or issuable to acquire the entity.

Term: Deferred Tax and Other Liabilities, Noncurrent
Explanation: Amount, after deferred tax asset, of deferred tax liability attributable to taxable differences, with jurisdictional netting, and liabilities classified as noncurrent and other.

Term: Deferred Tax Assets, Tax Credit Carryforwards
Explanation: Amount, before allocation of a valuation allowances, of deferred tax assets attributable to deductible tax credit carryforwards including, but not limited to, research, foreign, general business, alternative minimum tax, and other deductible tax credit carryforwards.

Term: Deferred Tax Liabilities, Tax Deferred Income
Explanation: Amount of deferred tax liability attributable to taxable temporary differences from tax deferred revenue or income classified as other.

Term: Defined Benefit Plan, Pension Plans with Accumulated Benefit Obligations in Excess of Plan Assets, Aggregate Accumulated Benefit Obligation
Explanation: If aggregate disclosures are presented, the aggregate pension accumulated benefit obligation for pension plans with accumulated benefit obligations in excess of plan assets as of the measurement date of each statement of financial position presented.

Term: Interest Rate Fair Value Hedge Asset at Fair Value
Explanation: Fair value as of the balance sheet date of all derivative assets designated as interest rate fair value hedging instruments.

Term: Operating Leases, Future Minimum Payments Due, Next Twelve Months
Explanation: Amount of required minimum rental payments for operating leases having an initial or remaining non-cancelable lease term in excess of one year due in the next fiscal year following the latest fiscal year. Excludes interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

Term: Payments for Deposits on Real Estate Acquisitions
Explanation: Cash outflow related to amounts given in advance to show or confirm an intention to complete an acquisition of land, buildings, other structures, or any item classified as real estate.

Term: Prepaid Expense, Current
Explanation: Amount of asset related to consideration paid in advance for costs that provide economic benefits within a future period of one year or the normal operating cycle, if longer.

Term: Real Estate Investment Property, Net
Explanation: Amount of real estate investment property, net of accumulated depreciation, which may include the following: (1) land available-for-sale; (2) land available-for-development; (3) investments in building and building improvements; (4) tenant allowances; (5) developments in-process; (6) rental properties; and (7) other real estate investments.

Term: Repayments of Senior Debt
Explanation: The cash outflow for a long-term debt where the holder has highest claim on the entity's asset in case of bankruptcy or liquidation during the period.

Term: Unamortized Debt Issuance Expense
Explanation: The remaining balance of debt issuance expenses that were capitalized and are being amortized against income over the lives of the respective bond issues. This does not include the amounts capitalized as part of the cost of the utility plant or asset.

Term: Debt Issuance Costs, Noncurrent, Net
Explanation: Amount, after accumulated amortization, of debt issuance costs classified as noncurrent. Includes, but is not limited to, legal, accounting, underwriting, printing, and registration costs.

Term: Deferred Tax Assets, Gross, Current
Explanation: Amount before allocation of valuation allowances of deferred tax asset attributable to deductible temporary differences and carryforwards classified as current.

Term: Due from Affiliate, Noncurrent
Explanation: Amount of receivables due from an entity that is affiliated with the reporting entity by means of direct or indirect ownership, due after 1 year (or 1 business cycle).

Term: Federal Home Loan Bank Borrowings, Fair Value Disclosure
Explanation: Fair value portion of borrowing from Federal Home Loan Bank (FHLBank).

Term: Interest Rate Fair Value Hedge Liability at Fair Value
Explanation: Fair value as of the balance sheet date of all derivative liabilities designated as interest rate fair value hedging instruments.

Term: Letters of Credit Outstanding, Amount
Explanation: The total amount of the contingent obligation under letters of credit outstanding as of the reporting date.

Term: Long-term Debt, Maturities, Repayments of Principal in Year Four
Explanation: Amount of long-term debt payable, sinking fund requirements, and other securities issued that are redeemable by holder at fixed or determinable prices and dates maturing in the fourth fiscal year following the latest fiscal year. Excludes interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

Term: Share-based Compensation Arrangement by Share-based Payment Award, Options, Exercisable, Intrinsic Value
Explanation: Amount of difference between fair value of the underlying shares reserved for issuance and exercise price of vested portions of options outstanding and currently exercisable.

Term: Unamortized Discounts on Acceptances Executed
Explanation: The amount of the unearned (fee) income on the financial institution's issuance of short-term negotiable time drafts (also known as Banker's Acceptances).

Term: Weighted Average Number of Shares Issued, Basic
